theorems.name: PNT Error Envelope (Unconditional)
theorems.statement: For all x >= 2, the prime counting remainder satisfies |psi(x) - x| <= C * x * exp(-c * sqrt(log x)) for effective constants C, c > 0.
theorems.source: de la Vallee Poussin (1899), with effective constants from Dusart, Schoenfeld, and others.
theorems.notes: This is the classical PNT error bound. It is unconditional and does not require RH.

theorems.name: RH-Style Error Envelope (Conditional)
theorems.statement: Assuming RH, for all x >= 2, the prime counting remainder satisfies |psi(x) - x| <= C * sqrt(x) * (log x)^2 for some effective constant C > 0.
theorems.notes: This envelope requires the Riemann Hypothesis. Global promotion via this theorem is blocked by default policy.

theorems.name: Weak Envelope 1 (Conditional)
theorems.statement: Assuming RH, for all x >= 2, the prime counting remainder satisfies |psi(x) - x| <= C * sqrt(x) * (log x)^3 for some effective constant C > 0.
theorems.source: Derived from RH-style with weaker log power.
theorems.notes: Weaker than RH-style. Still conditional on RH.

theorems.name: Weak Envelope 2 (Conditional)
theorems.statement: Assuming RH, for all x >= 2, the prime counting remainder satisfies |psi(x) - x| <= C * sqrt(x) * (log x)^4 for some effective constant C > 0.
theorems.source: Derived from RH-style with weaker log power.
theorems.notes: Weaker than Weak1. Still conditional on RH.
